oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nonextensive thermodynamic relations based on the assumption of temperature duality
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Zheng, Yahui
Du, Jiulin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Condensed Matter - Statistical Mechanics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The nonextensive thermodynamic relations are reexamined under the assumption of temperature duality, which endows different senses to "physical temperature" and "Lagrange temperature". Based on this assumption, two sets of parallel Legendre transform structures are established. One is called "physical" set, whose thermodynamic quantities are un-measurable in experiments, however are important in theory. Another is called "Lagrange" set, whose quantities are experimentally measurable. In the two formalisms, not only thermodynamic quantities but also their thermodynamic relations are both liked through Tsallis factor. The application of the two sets of thermodynamic relations shows that the heat capacity defined in the classical gravitating thermodynamics has no relevance to the stability of self-gravitating systems. Instead, the sign of the recently defined heat capacity determines the stability of self-gravitating systems.
